description.other_details: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/.

Exclusion of examination, Published archetype [Internet]. openEHR Foundation, openEHR Clinical Knowledge Manager [cited: 2022-07-25]. Available from: https://ckm.openehr.org/ckm/archetypes/1013.1.1846.

details.purpose: *To explicitly record that a diagnostic test was not performed. (en)
details.use:
*Use to explicitly record that a diagnostic test was not performed, with an optional statement about the reason for the non-performance.
This archetype has been designed to be used to allow recording of 'no test was done' at more than one level, as required, within the test result framework. It will never be used as a stand-alone archetype but always inside the OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result or CLUSTER.analyte archetypes that provides the context for the test.
The intention for this archetype is to avoid the need to use flags or terminology to express negation about a record of diagnostic testing within the health record.
It is reasonable to assume that if the entire test result was incomplete, then data about the component successfully performed will be recorded. (en)
details.misuse:
*Not to be used to record the details about diagnostic test result. Use specific archetypes for these purposes, such as the OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result or CLUSTER.analyte archetype.
Not to be used to record the exclusion or absence of adverse reactions, family history, medication use, procedures, problems or diagnoses, or physical examination - use EVALUATION.exclusion_global, EVALUATION.exclusion_specific or CLUSTER.exclusion_examination for this purpose. (en)
details.copyright: © Australian Digital Health Agency, openEHR Foundation, openEHR Foundation

details.purpose: To explicitly record that a diagnostic test was not performed.
details.use:
Use to explicitly record that a diagnostic test was not performed, with an optional statement about the reason for the non-performance.
This archetype has been designed to be used to allow recording of 'no test was done' at more than one level, as required, within the test result framework. It will never be used as a stand-alone archetype but always inside the OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result or CLUSTER.analyte archetypes that provides the context for the test.
The intention for this archetype is to avoid the need to use flags or terminology to express negation about a record of diagnostic testing within the health record.
It is reasonable to assume that if the entire test result was incomplete, then data about the component successfully performed will be recorded.
details.misuse:
Not to be used to record the details about diagnostic test result. Use specific archetypes for these purposes, such as the OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result or CLUSTER.analyte archetype.
Not to be used to record the exclusion or absence of adverse reactions, family history, medication use, procedures, problems or diagnoses, or physical examination - use EVALUATION.exclusion_global, EVALUATION.exclusion_specific or CLUSTER.exclusion_examination for this purpose.
details.copyright: © Australian Digital Health Agency, openEHR Foundation, openEHR Foundation

items.items: Positive statement to record that a diagnostic test was not performed.
Statement to explicity record that the diagnostic was not performed.
Record as True if the examination was not performed.
For example: patient factors, equipment factors, time constraints.
*Positive statement to record that a diagnostic test was not performed. (en)
*Statement to explicity record that the diagnostic was not performed. (en)
*Record as True if the examination was not performed. (en)
Zum Beispiel: patientenbezogene Gründe, Ausstattungsgründe, zeitliche Beschränkungen.
